verses.verse: If<WH3588> a man<WH376> shall steal<WH1589> an ox,<WH7794> or<WH176> a sheep,<WH7716> and kill<WH2873> it, or<WH176> sell<WH4376> it; he shall restore<WH7999> five<WH2568> oxen<WH1241> for an ox,<WH7794> and four<WH702> sheep<WH6629> for a sheep.<WH7716>
If<WH518> a thief<WH1590> be found<WH4672> breaking<WH4290> up, and be smitten<WH5221> that he die,<WH4191> there shall no<WH369> blood<WH1818> be shed for him.

If<WH518> the sun<WH8121> be risen<WH2224> on him, there shall be blood<WH1818> shed for him; for he should make full<WH7999> restitution;<WH7999> if<WH518> he have nothing,<WH369> then he shall be sold<WH4376> for his theft.<WH1591>

If<WH518> the theft<WH1591> be certainly found<WH4672> in his hand<WH3027> alive, whether<WH5704> it be ox,<WH7794> or<WH5704> ass,<WH2543> or<WH5704> sheep;<WH7716> he shall restore<WH7999> double.<WH8147>

If<WH518> a man<WH376> shall cause a field<WH7704> or<WH176> vineyard<WH3754> to be eaten,<WH1197> and shall put<WH7971> in his beast,<WH1165> and shall feed<WH1197> in another<WH312> man's<WH312> field;<WH7704> of the best<WH4315> of his own field,<WH7704> and of the best<WH4315> of his own vineyard,<WH3754> shall he make restitution.<WH7999>

If<WH3588> fire<WH784> break<WH3318> out, and catch<WH4672> in thorns,<WH6975> so that the stacks<WH1430> of corn, or<WH176> the standing<WH7054> corn,<WH7054> or<WH176> the field,<WH7704> be consumed<WH398> therewith; he that kindled<WH1197> the fire<WH1200> shall surely make restitution.<WH7999>

If<WH3588> a man<WH376> shall deliver<WH5414> to his neighbor<WH7453> money<WH3701> or<WH176> stuff<WH3627> to keep,<WH8104> and it be stolen<WH1589> out of the man's<WH376> house;<WH1004> if<WH518> the thief<WH1590> be found,<WH4672> let him pay<WH7999> double.<WH8147>

If<WH518> the thief<WH1590> be not found,<WH4672> then the master<WH1167> of the house<WH1004> shall be brought<WH7126> to the judges,<WH430> to see whether<WH518> <WH3808> he have put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> to his neighbor's<WH7453> goods.<WH4399>

For all<WH3605> manner<WH1697> of trespass,<WH6588> whether it be for ox,<WH7794> for ass,<WH2543> for sheep,<WH7716> for raiment,<WH8008> or for any<WH3605> manner of lost<WH9> thing which<WH834> another challenges<WH559> to be his, the cause<WH1697> of both<WH8147> parties shall come<WH935> before<WH5704> the judges;<WH430> and whom<WH834> the judges<WH430> shall condemn,<WH7561> he shall pay<WH7999> double<WH8147> to his neighbor.<WH7453>

If<WH3588> a man<WH376> deliver<WH5414> to his neighbor<WH7453> an ass,<WH2543> or<WH176> an ox,<WH7794> or<WH176> a sheep,<WH7716> or<WH176> any<WH3605> beast,<WH929> to keep;<WH8104> and it die,<WH4191> or<WH176> be hurt,<WH7665> or<WH176> driven<WH7617> away, no<WH369> man seeing<WH7200> it:

Then shall an oath<WH7621> of the LORD<WH3068> be between<WH996> them both,<WH8147> that he has not put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> to his neighbor's<WH7453> goods;<WH4399> and the owner<WH1167> of it shall accept<WH3947> thereof, and he shall not make it good.<WH7999>
And if<WH518> it be stolen<WH1589> from him, he shall make restitution<WH7999> to the owner<WH1167> thereof.
If<WH518> it be torn<WH2963> in pieces, then let him bring<WH935> it for witness,<WH5707> and he shall not make good<WH7999> that which was torn.<WH2966>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> borrow<WH7592> ought of his neighbor,<WH7453> and it be hurt,<WH7665> or<WH176> die,<WH4191> the owner<WH1167> thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good.<WH7999>
But if<WH518> the owner<WH1167> thereof be with it, he shall not make it good:<WH7999> if<WH518> it be an hired<WH7916> thing, it came<WH935> for his hire.<WH7939>
And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> entice<WH6601> a maid<WH1330> that is not betrothed,<WH781> and lie<WH7901> with her, he shall surely endow<WH4117> her to be his wife.<WH802>
If<WH518> her father<WH1> utterly refuse<WH3985> to give<WH5414> her to him, he shall pay<WH8254> money<WH3701> according to the dowry<WH4119> of virgins.<WH1330>
You shall not suffer a witch<WH3784> to live.<WH2421>
Whoever<WH3605> lies<WH7901> with a beast<WH929> shall surely be put to death.<WH4191>
He that sacrifices<WH2076> to any god,<WH430> save<WH1115> to the LORD<WH3068> only,<WH905> he shall be utterly destroyed.<WH2763>
You shall neither<WH3808> vex<WH3238> a stranger,<WH1616> nor<WH3808> oppress<WH3905> him: for you were strangers<WH1616> in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
You shall not afflict<WH6031> any<WH3605> widow,<WH490> or fatherless<WH3490> child.
If<WH518> you afflict<WH6031> them in any wise,<WH6031> and they cry<WH6817> at all to me, I will surely hear<WH8085> their cry;<WH6818>
And my wrath<WH639> shall wax hot,<WH2734> and I will kill<WH2026> you with the sword;<WH2719> and your wives<WH802> shall be widows,<WH490> and your children<WH1121> fatherless.<WH3490>

If<WH518> you lend<WH3867> money<WH3701> to any of my people<WH5971> that is poor<WH6041> by you, you shall not be to him as an usurer,<WH5383> neither<WH3808> shall you lay<WH7760> on him usury.<WH5392>
If<WH518> you at all take<WH2254> your neighbor's<WH7453> raiment<WH8008> to pledge,<WH2254> you shall deliver<WH7725> it to him by that the sun<WH8121> goes<WH935> down:<WH935>

For that is his covering<WH3682> only,<WH905> it is his raiment<WH8071> for his skin:<WH5785> wherein<WH4100> shall he sleep?<WH7901> and it shall come<WH1961> to pass, when<WH3588> he cries<WH6817> to me, that I will hear;<WH8085> for I am gracious.<WH2587>
You shall not revile<WH7043> the gods,<WH430> nor<WH3808> curse<WH779> the ruler<WH5387> of your people.<WH5971>
You shall not delay<WH309> to offer the first<WH4395> of your ripe fruits,<WH4395> and of your liquors:<WH1831> the firstborn<WH1060> of your sons<WH1121> shall you give<WH5414> to me.

Likewise<WH3651> shall you do<WH6213> with your oxen,<WH7794> and with your sheep:<WH6629> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> it shall be with his dam;<WH517> on the eighth<WH8066> day<WH3117> you shall give<WH5414> it me.

And you shall be holy<WH6944> men<WH582> to me: neither<WH3808> shall you eat<WH398> any flesh<WH1320> that is torn<WH2966> of beasts<WH2966> in the field;<WH7704> you shall cast<WH7993> it to the dogs.<WH3611>
